collections.name: mailcow API
collections.description:
mailcow is complete e-mailing solution with advanced antispam, antivirus, nice UI and API.

In order to use this API you have to create a API key and add your IP address to the whitelist of allowed IPs this can be done by logging into the Mailcow UI using your admin account, then go to Configuration > Access > Edit administrator details > API. There you will find a collapsed API menu.

**This documentation is in Work In Progress status. It contains only few endpoints.**

folders.name: Domain antispam policies
folders.description: You can create antispam whitelist and blacklist policies

requests.name: Get domains
requests.description: You can list all domains existing in system.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

pathVariableData.description: id of entry you want to get
id of entry you want to get

requests.name: Create domain
requests.description: You may create your own domain using this action. It takes a JSON object containing a domain informations.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Update domain
requests.description:
You can update one or more domains per request. You can also send just attributes you want to change.
Example: You can add domain names to items list and in attr object just include `"active": "0"` to deactivate domains.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Delete domain
requests.description: You can delete one or more domains.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: List whitelist domain policy
requests.description: You can list all whitelist policies per domain.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: List blacklist domain policy
requests.description: You can list all blacklist policies per domain.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Create domain policy
requests.description: You may create your own domain policy using this action. It takes a JSON object containing a domain informations.

Accept: application/json

requests.name: Delete domain policy
requests.description: You can delete one o more domain policies.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json

Accept: application/json

requests.name: Create alias
requests.description:
You may create your own mailbox alias using this action. It takes a JSON object containing a domain informations.
Only one `goto*` option can be used, for ex. if you want learn as spam, then send just `goto_spam = 1` in request body.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Update alias
requests.description: You can update one or more aliases per request. You can also send just attributes you want to change
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Delete alias
requests.description: You can delete one or more aliases.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Add Forward Host

X-API-Key: api-key-string

Accept: application/json

requests.name: Get Queue
requests.description: Get the current mail queue and everything it contains.
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Flush Queue
requests.description:
Using this API you can flush the current mail queue. This will try to deliver all mails currently in it.
This API uses the command: `postqueue -f`
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json

requests.name: Delete Queue
requests.description:
Using this API you can delete the current mail queue. This will delete all mails in it.
This API uses the command: `postsuper -d`
requests.headers:
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Key: api-key-string
Accept: application/json
